page.title: 13CATTLE
page.content: The only livestock on the smaller farm is a herd of 120 cattle which are kept on the 50 acres of clay soil which is too heavy and wet for ploughing.The calves are bought at twelve weeks old and are kept for 18 months thus being sold for beef the next Chistmas in the year following, via the agency which arranged their purchase.Their winter feed is concentrates plus barley off the farm and silage made on the farm by a firm of contractors. They are kept in shelters with concrete floors and with feeding mangers along the sides.In the summer they are given feed extra to the grazing.The breeds in this year are Friesian X Hereford,Limousin,and Simmertal fairly new to Britain.Red tags on their ears denote heifers and blue tags for bullocks.
